paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on a KCNH2 variant associated with long QT syndrome type 2, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

individual_records.phenotype_details: diagnosed with long QT syndrome type 2, treated with metoprolol, experienced palpitations and ventricular arrhythmias
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A 40-year-old woman, weighing 74 kg, was identified on cascade screening to have LQTS type 2, with the mutation NM_000238.3(KCNH2):c.2593-2A>G, predicted to cause a splice-site disruption resulting in a truncated protein.

individual_records.phenotype_details: younger sister of the proband, no symptoms reported
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The proband was her younger sister, a previous multisport competitor who had an internal defibrillator implanted in 2005 after investigation of syncopal episodes during extreme physical strain and appropriate internal defibrillator shocks during follow-up.

functional_data.summary: The variant is predicted to cause a splice-site disruption resulting in a truncated protein.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family as the proband and her sister are both carriers.
variants.additional_notes: The variant had not previously been reported in patients with LQTS or in healthy controls.
key_quotes: This rare variant had not previously been reported in patients with LQTS or in healthy controls.
It has been classified locally as pathogenic according to the guidelines of the American College of Medical Genetics.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the KCNH2 variant was extracted from the main text.
